her speech shall be low out of the dust. "Ariel, after being besieged, descends into the land of the dead, becoming like a ghost." In the same way, like Jerusalem and her people, the Jaredite and Nephite nations were destroyed and their peoples became part of the dust of the earth. As Jerusalem shall cry to us out of the dust through her records, so shall the Jaredites and Nephites speak to us through the Book of Mormon (2 1 Ne. 3:19; 26:16; 33:13; Morm. 8:23; Moro. 10:27).

familiar spirit. This phrase refers to a ghost or spirit. Jews will bear testimony of their offenses and the resulting punishment, as will the Jaredites and Nephites, who speak "out of the ground," as it were, through their written records. "Here Nephi applies Isaiah's words to the departed of his own people who, through the Book of Mormon, speak to those of the last days from the grave with a voice of warning."
